body.p: The use of the word ‘currently’ in paragraph 42(a) of IAS 32 means that the right of set‑off cannot be contingent on a future event. If a right of set‑off were contingent or conditional on a future event an entity would not currently have a (legally enforceable) right of set‑off. The right of set‑off would not exist until the contingency occurred, if at all.
